com.github.wuic.util

Class PollingScheduler<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.wuic.util.PollingScheduler<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of listener
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractNutDao, ContextBuilderConfigurator

    public abstract class PollingScheduler<T>
extends Object
implements Runnable

    This class is able to schedule a polling operation in the WuicScheduledThreadPool.

    Since:
    0.4.0
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Guillaume DROUET

      This class represents a polling information.

        public PollingScheduler()

    • Method Detail

      • observe

        public final void observe(String pattern,
           T... listeners)
                   throws IOException

        Adds a set of listeners to be notified when a polling operation is perform on a nut matching the given pattern.

        Parameters:
        pattern - the pattern to use to retrieve the different real paths to poll
        listeners - some listeners to be notified when an update has been detected on a nut
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O occurs while retrieving last update of the nut

      • getNutObservers

        public Map<T,? extends PollingScheduler.Polling> getNutObservers()

        Gets polling data with observers.

        Returns:
        the observers

      • getPollingInterval

        public final int getPollingInterval()

        Returns the polling interval.

        Returns:
        the polling interval

      • setPollingInterval

        public final void setPollingInterval(int intervalSeconds)

        Defines a new polling interval. If current polling operation are currently processed, then they are not interrupted and a new scheduling is created if the given value is a positive number. If the value is not positive, then no polling will occur.

        Parameters:
        intervalSeconds - interval in seconds

      • getLastUpdateTimestampFor

        protected abstract Long getLastUpdateTimestampFor(String path)
                                           throws IOException

        Retrieves a timestamp that indicates the last time this nut has changed.

        Parameters:
        path - the real path of the nut
        Returns:
        the timestamp
        Throws:
        IOException - if any I/O error occurs
